com.forgerock.opendj.cli

Class Utils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.forgerock.opendj.cli.Utils

  • public final class Utils
extends Object
    This class provides utility functions for all the client side tools.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

    • Field Detail

      • LINE_SEPARATOR

        public static final String LINE_SEPARATOR
        Platform appropriate line separator.

      • OBFUSCATED_VALUE

        public static final String OBFUSCATED_VALUE
        The value used to display arguments that must be obfuscated (such as passwords). This does not require localization (since the output of command builder by its nature is not localized).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CONFIRMATION_MAX_TRIES

        public static final int CONFIRMATION_MAX_TRIES
        The maximum number of times we try to confirm.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DATE_FORMAT_LOCAL_TIME

        public static final String DATE_FORMAT_LOCAL_TIME
        The date format string that will be used to construct and parse dates represented using generalized time. It is assumed that the provided date formatter will be set to UTC.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SHELL_COMMENT_SEPARATOR

        public static final String SHELL_COMMENT_SEPARATOR
        The String used to write comments in a shell (or batch) script.

      • MAX_LINE_WIDTH

        public static final int MAX_LINE_WIDTH
        The column at which to wrap long lines of output in the command-line tools.

      • formatDateTimeStringForEquivalentCommand

        public static String formatDateTimeStringForEquivalentCommand(Date date)
        Formats a Date to String representation in "dd/MMM/yyyy:HH:mm:ss Z".
        Parameters:
        date - The date to format; null if date is null.
        Returns:
        A string representation of the date.

      • filterExitCode

        public static int filterExitCode(int exitCode)
        Filters the provided value to ensure that it is appropriate for use as an exit code. Exit code values are generally only allowed to be between 0 and 255, so any value outside of this range will be converted to 255, which is the typical exit code used to indicate an overflow value.
        Parameters:
        exitCode - The exit code value to be processed.
        Returns:
        An integer value between 0 and 255, inclusive. If the provided exit code was already between 0 and 255, then the original value will be returned. If the provided value was out of this range, then 255 will be returned.

      • readBytesFromFile

        public static byte[] readBytesFromFile(String filePath)
                                throws IOException
        Read the data from the specified file and return it in a byte array.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The path to the file that should be read.
        Returns:
        A byte array containing the contents of the requested file.
        Throws:
        IOException - If a problem occurs while trying to read the specified file.

      • secondsToTimeString

        public static org.forgerock.i18n.LocalizableMessage secondsToTimeString(int numSeconds)
        Retrieves a user-friendly string that indicates the length of time (in days, hours, minutes, and seconds) in the specified number of seconds.
        Parameters:
        numSeconds - The number of seconds to be converted to a more user-friendly value.
        Returns:
        The user-friendly representation of the specified number of seconds.

      • wrapText

        public static String wrapText(org.forgerock.i18n.LocalizableMessage message,
                              int width)
        Inserts line breaks into the provided buffer to wrap text at no more than the specified column width. Wrapping will only be done at space boundaries and if there are no spaces within the specified width, then wrapping will be performed at the first space after the specified column.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be wrapped.
        width - The maximum number of characters to allow on a line if there is a suitable breaking point.
        Returns:
        The wrapped text.

      • wrapText

        public static String wrapText(org.forgerock.i18n.LocalizableMessage message,
                              int width,
                              int indent)
        Inserts line breaks into the provided buffer to wrap text at no more than the specified column width. Wrapping will only be done at space boundaries and if there are no spaces within the specified width, then wrapping will be performed at the first space after the specified column. In addition each line will be indented by the specified amount.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be wrapped.
        width - The maximum number of characters to allow on a line if there is a suitable breaking point (including any indentation).
        indent - The number of columns to indent each line.
        Returns:
        The wrapped text.

      • wrapText

        public static String wrapText(String text,
                              int width)
        Inserts line breaks into the provided buffer to wrap text at no more than the specified column width. Wrapping will only be done at space boundaries and if there are no spaces within the specified width, then wrapping will be performed at the first space after the specified column.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to be wrapped.
        width - The maximum number of characters to allow on a line if there is a suitable breaking point.
        Returns:
        The wrapped text.

      • wrapText

        public static String wrapText(String text,
                              int width,
                              int indent)
        Inserts line breaks into the provided buffer to wrap text at no more than the specified column width. Wrapping will only be done at space boundaries and if there are no spaces within the specified width, then wrapping will be performed at the first space after the specified column. In addition each line will be indented by the specified amount.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to be wrapped.
        width - The maximum number of characters to allow on a line if there is a suitable breaking point (including any indentation).
        indent - The number of columns to indent each line.
        Returns:
        The wrapped text.

      • isCertificateException

        public static boolean isCertificateException(Throwable t)
        Tells whether the provided Throwable was caused because of a problem with a certificate while trying to establish a connection.
        Parameters:
        t - The Throwable to analyze.
        Returns:
        true if the provided Throwable was caused because of a problem with a certificate while trying to establish a connection and false otherwise.

        hostPort - The hostPort representation of the server we were contacting when the IOException occurred.

      • getAdministratorDN

        public static DN getAdministratorDN(String uid)
        Returns the DN of the global administrator for a given UID.
        Parameters:
        uid - The UID to be used to generate the DN.
        Returns:
        The DN of the administrator for the given UID.

      • getHostNameForLdapUrl

        public static String getHostNameForLdapUrl(String host)
        Returns the string that can be used to represent a given host name in a LDAP URL. This method must be used when we have IPv6 addresses (the address in the LDAP URL must be enclosed with brackets).

        E.g: 

          -h "[2a01:e35:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx]"
        Note: it would be nice to replace this method by HostPort
        Parameters:
        host - The host name.
        Returns:
        The String that can be used to represent a given host name in a LDAP URL.

                                    String message)

      • throwIfArgumentsConflict

        public static void throwIfArgumentsConflict(Argument arg1,
                                            Argument arg2)
                                     throws ArgumentException
        Throws an ArgumentException if both provided Argument are presents in the command line arguments.
        Parameters:
        arg1 - The first Argument which should not be present if arg2 is.
        arg2 - The second Argument which should not be present if arg1 is.
        Throws:
        ArgumentException - If both provided Argument are presents in the command line arguments

      • addErrorMessageIfArgumentsConflict

        public static void addErrorMessageIfArgumentsConflict(Collection<org.forgerock.i18n.LocalizableMessage> errors,
                                                      Argument arg1,
                                                      Argument arg2)
        Adds a LocalizableMessage to the provided Collection if both provided Argument are presents in the command line arguments.
        Parameters:
        errors - The Collection<LocalizableMessage> to use to add the conflict error (if occurs).
        arg1 - The first Argument which should not be present if arg2 is.
        arg2 - The second Argument which should not be present if arg1 is.

      • appendErrorMessageIfArgumentsConflict

        public static boolean appendErrorMessageIfArgumentsConflict(org.forgerock.i18n.LocalizableMessageBuilder builder,
                                                            Argument arg1,
                                                            Argument arg2)
        Return true if provided Argument are presents in the command line arguments.

        If so, adds a LocalizableMessage to the provided LocalizableMessageBuilder.

        Parameters:
        builder - The LocalizableMessageBuilder to use to write the conflict error (if occurs).
        arg1 - The first Argument which should not be present if arg2 is.
        arg2 - The second Argument which should not be present if arg1 is.
        Returns:
        true if provided Argument are presents in the command line arguments.

      • conflictingArgsErrorMessage

        public static org.forgerock.i18n.LocalizableMessage conflictingArgsErrorMessage(Argument arg1,
                                                                                Argument arg2)
        Returns a LocalizableMessage which explains to the user that provided Arguments can not be used together on the command line.
        Parameters:
        arg1 - The first Argument which conflicts with arg2.
        arg2 - The second Argument which conflicts with arg1.
        Returns:
        A LocalizableMessage which explains to the user that arguments can not be used together on the command line.
